subject: Languages
title: What Will English Sound Like in 500 Years?
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Will English Sound Like in 500 Years?.

hook.text: If you traveled 500 years into the future, you might not understand English. Just as we can't understand Chaucer.

buildup.text: Based on current trends, linguists can predict some changes: 'th' sounds may disappear, 'whom' will be gone.

discovery.text: Non-native speakers now outnumber native ones 3 to 1. Their patterns will reshape English from outside.

twist.text: Recording technology might slow change for the first time â€” people hear 'standard' forms constantly.

climax.text: But language change has never been stopped by technology, authority, or effort. It always finds a way.

punchline.text: English will change. We just don't get to choose how. Nobody ever has.

quiz.question: Why might English change more slowly in the future?
options: Recording technology exposes speakers to standard forms constantly
Grammar rules are being enforced by law
